content: If we are using docker, will my Postgresql instance be used? or docker creates everything, confined?
I mean, I don't want my actual Postgresql database to be used (too many applications depending on it)
@PeGaSuS The docker-compose setup includes its own PostgreSQL container.
thanks. I really need to checkout the docker thing. I've never used it. I can assume that __all__ dependencies are installed inside the container, right? nginx, etc..
@PeGaSuS our Docker setup uses multiple containers, but yes, they each contain all necessary dependencies.

thanks. good to know. I need to look better into the docs. I have Apache as my main webserver and lots of services already depending on Postgresql and MySQL. that's why I can't afford myself to have changes in my main databases
I was in similar situation as you a few days back. You dont need to worry about the DB, the db within the compose file is good enough.
can anyone just tell me if we can run separate conainer for nginx as well.any help will be greatly appreciated
